Posts.Content: I am getting chemo first too.  I start next Thursday all being well.  I am grade 3 IDC with lymph node involvement.  I don't know my stage yet.  X
Posts.Title: Chemo before surgery?

Posts.Content: Hello everyone, I start radiotherapy on Wednesday the 11th, having 15 sessions.  I live in Fife and need to travel to the western general in Edinburgh for my appointments. My appointment times are 9:10 so the traffic going into Edinburgh will be crazy busy.  I live about 45 minutes from the hospital but the commuter traffic will likely double my journey time at least.  Hope everyone has an enjoyable weekend.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Pam,  Happy birthday.  I went to start my radiotherapy today and my shape has changed since my planning appointment.  They think I may have had a seroma which has drained itself,  so I had another planning ct today and my radiotherapy will now start next Thursday.  Wishing you all well  X
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Morning,  hope you get on well today.  I am starting TCH tomorrow.  No P for me as it's not NHS funded in Scotland.  I recieved a call from the chemo ward yesterday saying I was in for appointments today and tomorrow but they will just give me everything together on Friday.  I think they have to do the first dose of herceptin really slowly and monitor you for 6 hours for side effects.   I was asked to attend for 9:30 tomorrow and advised I will be there for at least 7 hours.  I was diagnosed on the 8 th of August and was due to start chemo last month but o have encountered so many delays and hurdles and curve balls.   I am glad to finally be about to start treatment.  (I too am chemo before surger)  however  am very scared.  Xx
Posts.Title: P-TCH chemo before surgery

Posts.Content: Yes I have the same injections.  I have to do them for ten days.   I have not yet experienced the sore mouth yet.  I wonder if it's the P that you get that causes it.   I don't get the P as it's not nhs funded in Scotland just now.   I forget what it's called  sorry x
Posts.Title: P-TCH chemo before surgery

Posts.Content: Jo.   Hello.  I read your blog.  I was diagnosed on 8th Augus, had biopsies taken from breast and suspicious lymph node on the 11th. Got the results on the 22nd of August.   Grade 3 IDC with lymph node involvement.  Initially I was told HER 2+ although was told they would be doing further testinG. I am borderline positive for Estrogen.    Then I went for lots of staging scans, tiny spot found on liver but too small to say for definite what it is.  Going to have it rescanned with the hope it stays the same and doesn't respond to treatment as that would confirm spread.   So I was due to start fec-t on September 14th but ejection fraction results were low.  So has heart echo and repeat ecg.  Results came back better but onc thinks tch will be best plaN.   So. Hopes to start tch last week but then got word that I needed to go for kidney function tests with the radioactive dye.   So I had that yesterday so fingers crossed the resujts are fine.  On Monday I went for mammogram and ultrasound to confirm baseline before chemo. However new tumour areas were found so I got more core biopsies.  Hoping it's scabbed up enough for chemo which o hope will finally start tomorrow.  I never expected things to go smoothly but it's been one thing after another.  From the initial 5 week wait for my urgent referral. - I went private for initial consultation which meant I was seen on the 8th of August instead of the 30th.  My breast hurts everyday.  Every day it changes shape and I have watched my nipple all but disappear.  I had to stop my anxiety meds as they may have affected my heart results.  I was started on tamoxifen two weeks ago to try and slow down the tumour growth till chemo starts so I am blaming that on my grumpiness.   I am a lone parent to an 11 and 12 year old.  I am getting tired of being strong and I just want someone to tell me it's going to be ok.    I am deep cleaning my house again today in anticipation of starting chemo tomorrow.   My sons break off on school holidays tomorrow for two weeks (we are in Scotlan) and although glad we don't have to get up for the school routine  I am scared of the side effects.  I know you will all understand.     I am feeling very sorry for myself today.   I will have a good cry though and get it out and feel better after.  X
Posts.Title: P-TCH chemo before surgery

Posts.Content: I have to self adminmister the bone marrow production injections for the first ten days after my chemo.  These can cause bad bone pain.  My onc told me not to leave the ward without a prescription for gabapentin.     I haven't needed it yet but i am glad to know I have it.  What day did your stingy throats and mouths start on?  X
Posts.Title: P-TCH chemo before surgery

Posts.Content: I had my first dose on the 6th of October.  Due again on the 27th.   Today has been so much more bearable.   I slept so well last night.  My taste buds are a bit off and I don't know what I fancy to eat.  I feel weak and off but not as awful as I felt yesterday.  Hope today is kind to you all.  X
Posts.Title: P-TCH chemo before surgery

Posts.Content: What a fright, there will be a plan b.  X
Posts.Title: P-TCH chemo before surgery

Posts.Content: Good morning friends, i had my herceptin and tax and Carboplantin on Friday. I was so apprehensive but the day went smoothly and actually the 7 hours passed quickly.    fri night and Saturday I felt well and got out and about with my sons, went shopping and to the cinema.    last night I gave myself my first injection to atimulate the bone marrow.  It was again easier than I thought.  I also very soundly, waking up in the same position I fell asleep in.   My limbs feel a little heavier today and I don't Think I will be doing too much today.  I am just about to get up and make breakfast and take my morning meds.  So far i am eating well and my taste buds haven't been affected Yet.    I have moved my bowels very regularly but nothing too loose. (Tmi).  I am aware this could be the calm before the storm but I feel a lot better for now than I anticipated. hope you are all well.  X
Posts.Title: P-TCH chemo before surgery

Posts.Content: My skin has broken down a little too ESP where i have had plasters in the last week.  I have great admiration for you attempting work and even greater admiration for putting yourself first and taking some time Off.  I am a single parent to two boys and I am doing what i have to and then resting.  I seen to be having the 'tax trots' now.  Seriously it's like whenver I am vertical I need to go empty my bowels with urgency.   Not un-manageable.  X
Posts.Title: P-TCH chemo before surgery

Posts.Content: You have certainly been through the mill. I hope you get the clarification on the next stage of your plan on Tuesday.  How are you feeling, how are you recovering from your mastectomy?  X
Posts.Title: My left breast has been removed

Posts.Content: I have had a sore throat at some point each cycle.  This time I also have a cold and my voice is coming and going.   How do you feel otherwise? How's your temperature? Any concerns at all give the cancer care line a call.  I was advised not to take any over the counter meds without consulting the chemo care line.  X
Posts.Title: Lost my voice

Posts.Content: I am glad your tickly couch has eased a little.  My chemo regime is also TCH (the docetaxal, carboplatin and herceptin )   I get number five of six tomorrow. And all being well I finish on the 19th Of jan.  I had my mid way ultrasound in November and I am responding well to the chemk. One of my breast tumours has dissapeared all together and the other which was the biggest is shrinking in all directions.  it has been suggested that I will have a single mastectomy in February and full lymph node removal.  My tumours were affecting the skin and also one was right behind my nipple hence the suggestion of a full mastectomy.   At the moment i don’t want any reconstruction butvwill listen to what the surgeon has to say.  I am having full node removal as a biopsy at my initial diagnosis showed lymph involvement.  I have a holiday booked to Turkey at the beginning of June and my team want to make sure I am finished this treatment to go.  If they removed some lymph nodes there is a chance I would get recalled for further surgery which would likely interfere with the holiday.   I may get radiotherapy too, guess it depends on the pathology. i was sadly also diagnosed with a secondary met in my liver.  Had been a suspicious area from the staging scans but too small to be sure.  The mid way scans showed that this are had too shrunk with the chemo which means it’s cancer.  I am hopeful it continues to shrink as my team have a plan for me.  So in them I trust.   I am devastated and scared but not letting the worries about tomorrow steal my joy from today.  I have every intention of being around as long as I can for my children.   Take care  x
Posts.Title: Lost my voice

Posts.Content: I developed a very sore nose after my second cycle of tax, carbo and herceptin.   Was very sore for ten days, still tender now as I am nearing the date for my 3rd dose. Hoping it doesn’t flare up again.  I didn’t have any visible scabs, but felt like there should have been loads. Hurt to even twitch my nose.  X
Posts.Title: Nose sores!!

Posts.Content: Hi Deirdre.  I have this too. I have had 7 doses of herceptin, 6 with chemo and one on its own.  My muscle pain mostly in both my thighs started between my 6th and 7th dose.   I have had it for ten days now, it’s relentless and very sore.   I feel very debilitated as I am struggling to move around.  I don’t have any answers but wanted you to know you are not the only one. X
Posts.Title: Herceptin and muscle pain

Posts.Content: I had a mid way ultra sound on my breast  after chemo  number 3 and I believe I will have another one after my last cycle (TODAY) before I have surgery.   X
Posts.Title: Neo adjuvant chemotherapy, midway scan

Posts.Content: hi.  I have the bone marrow inducing jags to take for ten days, starting 24 hours after my chemo.  From day 8 I have the sore bone pain and stomach cramps and loose bowels.  This usually lasts around four days.   I am finding it quite dibilitating as the stomach cramps come out of nowhere and I am stuck in the bathroom quite  a while.   Its putting me off leaving the house.  I have little appetite and feel nauseous but I think that’s because I am not really eating little and often   my temperature etc is all fine.  Anybody else had similar side effects?  X
Posts.Title: Side effects of bone marrow injection

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear about the loss of your father in law.  I had a liver mri yesterday.  I have mammograms and ultrasounds on the 4th and see my oncologist on the 5th.  Will see what she’s saying then.  I have tried to put the whole liver thing out of my mind.  Will let you know how I get on though.  Hoping that I am responding to the chemo and that the liver spot is a fatty lump (like approx 75% of me!!) How are you getting on?  X
Posts.Title: Jumped to breast cancer secondary forum and had no responses to my...

Posts.Content: Hi Lou, I don’t know anything about the gem treatment you are on.  I just wanted to say I am sorry you are feeling low just now.  I was diagnosed in August.  Started chemo in October, having tax, carboplantin and herceptin.  Having another liver mri next week as something showed up on my staging scans but too small to determine at time.  I am very scared and anxious and can relate to how you are feeling.  Hope you get some feedback about your treatment regime soon.  Take care x
Posts.Title: Jumped to breast cancer secondary forum and had no responses to my...

Posts.Content: Evening all,  For those receiving the zoladex injection- how soon after the first injection did you start taking the letrazol?  Thanks
Posts.Title: Zoladex and letrazol

Posts.Content: Oh Lou, sending you a big hug.  Sorry that you are in this position.  What a blow.   I hope you get answers soon and get a plan.  I don't know what else to say but I am thinking about you and sending you my best wishes x
Posts.Title: Scared, I think my breast cancer has gone to my liver....

Posts.Content: Happy birthday! I was diagnosed in August and my next 'annual' birthday is not till Feb. You have got me thinking that I might like to mark my aging in months now and not wait out just for the big annual thing! Not because I don't think I won't have many more but just because I can.  Have a fabulous day and here's to many more. X
Posts.Title: A birthday i thought I'd never reach...
